column2: TEACHING MATHEMATICS IN MIDDLE CHILDHOOD I
column4: EPSY 29525; and MATH 14001 and MATH 14002; and admission to advanced study.
column6: Examine issues and trends in mathematics and mathematics education. Theories of the teaching and learning of mathematics will be addressed within the context of problem solving, communications, reasoning and connections with other disciplines.

column2: INTEGRATED SOCIAL STUDIES AND SCIENCE IN MIDDLE CHILDHOOD
column6: Introductory methods course integrating social studies and science. Emphasis on principles of teaching and learning as applied to teaching to social issues and problems appropriate for middle childhood students.

column2: TEACHING AND LEARNING IN MIDDLE CHILDHOOD
column4: Admission to advanced study and middle childhood education (MCED) major.
column6: Theories of learning and classroom management and their application to teaching in grades 4-9 classrooms with diverse learners. 15 credit hours of field experience in grades 4-5. Students are required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at their assigned ¿school/agency¿ before the first day of the semester in which student teaching/ internship will take place.

column2: TEACHING MATHEMATICS IN MIDDLE CHILDHOOD II
column4: MCED 30001 and admission to advanced study.
column6: To develop knowledge of the theories, materials and methods used to teach mathematics in the contemporary classroom for grades 4-9 and develop skill in their use.

column2: TEACHING SCIENCE IN THE MIDDLE CHILDHOOD II
column4: MCED 30002 and admission to advanced study.
column6: Individual and group work develop effective techniques of teaching science concepts to 8-14 year olds. Attention given to methods equipment safety and planning. This course includes 40 field clinical hours. Students are required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at their assigned ¿school/agency¿ before the first day of the semester in which student teaching/ internship will take place.

column2: TEACHING SOCIAL STUDIES IN MIDDLE CHILDHOOD II
column4: MCED 30002 and admission to advanced study.
column6: Advanced methods course. Examines the purpose of citizenship education and understanding the role of history and the social sciences. Applying the principles of powerful teaching. Includes a major field experience at the student teaching site. Students are required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at their assigned ¿school/agency¿ before the first day of the semester in which student teaching/ internship will take place.

column2: EFFECTIVE USE OF PHONICS IN READING
column6: The influence of theoretical perspectives on word identification instruction, an examination of the role of phonics in reading and writing strategies for effective phonics instruction and assessment.

column2: READING AND WRITING IN MIDDLE CHILDHOOD
column6: Understanding of literacy learning in the middle childhood (ages 8-14) with emphasis on the development of reading and writing processes, strategies for text learning, literacy in electronic environments, authentic assessment and teaching children who struggle as readers.

column2: TEACHING READING WITH LITERATURE IN MIDDLE CHILDHOOD
column4: MCED 40006 and admission to advanced study.
column6: The study of the teaching of reading with literature with middle childhood students within an integrated language arts approach in a comprehensive literature program.

column2: TEACHING MATHEMATICS IN THE INTERMEDIATE YEARS, GRADES 4-5
column4: ECED 40147 with a minimum grade of C.
column6: To develop knowledge of the theories, materials and methods used to teach mathematics in the contemporary classroom for grades 4-5 and develop skill in their use.

column2: CURRICULUM AND ORGANIZATION IN MIDDLE CHILDHOOD
column4: Admission to advanced study and middle childhood education (MCED) major and MCED 31000.
column6: History, philosophy, curricula and organization of schools serving early adolescents in grades 4-9. Emphasis on development of programs and curricula and early adolescent development. 15 credit hours of field experience in grades 6-9. Students are required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at their assigned ¿school/agency¿ before the first day of the semester in which student teaching/ internship will take place.

column2: STUDENT TEACHING IN MIDDLE CHILDHOOD
column4: MCED 41000 and MCED 40007 and admission to advanced study.
column6: Full-time student teaching for twelve weeks in two selected concentrations (mathematics, science, language arts, social studies) and reading in grades 4-5 or grades 6-7-8. Students are required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at their assigned ¿school/agency¿ before the first day of the semester in which student teaching/ internship will take place.

column2: CRITICAL INQUIRY AND INTEGRATION: SCIENCE AND SOCIAL STUDIES, GRADE 4
column6: Introduces students to fourth grade content using an interdisciplinary, inquiry approach to teaching and learning in science and social studies.

column2: CRITICAL INQUIRY AND INTEGRATION: SCIENCE AND SOCIAL STUDIES, GRADE 5
column6: Engages students in the use and development of pedagogical content knowledge for teaching grade 5 using an interdisciplinary, inquiry approach to teaching and learning in science and social studies.

column2: INQUIRY INTO PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE: MIDDLE CHILDHOOD
column6: A seminar linked to student teaching with an emphasis on action research as professional development; completion of professional portfolios; professional ethics; and legal, medical and ethical issues in teaching.

column2: TEACHING SCIENCE IN MIDDLE CHILDHOOD II
column6: Individual and group work develop effective techniques of teaching science concepts to 8-14 year olds. Attention given to methods, equipment safety and planning. This course includes 40 field/clinical hours. Students are required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at their assigned ¿school/agency¿ before the first day of the semester in which student teaching/ internship will take place.

column2: TEACHING SOCIAL STUDIES IN MIDDLE CHILDHOOD II
column6: Advanced methods course. Examines the purpose of citizenship education and understanding the role of history and the social sciences. Applying the principles of powerful teaching. Includes a major field experience at the student teaching site. Students are required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at their assigned ¿school/agency¿ before the first day of the semester in which student teaching/ internship will take place.

column2: EFFECTIVE USE OF PHONICS IN READING
column6: The influence of theoretical perspectives on word identification instruction, an examination of the role of phonics in reading and writing, strategies for effective phonics instruction and assessment.

column2: READING AND WRITING IN MIDDLE CHILDHOOD
column6: Understanding of literacy learning in the middle childhood (classrooms grades 4-9) with emphasis on the development of reading and writing processes, strategies for text learning, literacy in electronic environments, authentic assessment and teaching children who struggle as readers.

column2: TEACHING READING WITH LITERATURE IN MIDDLE CHILDHOOD
column6: The study of the teaching of reading with literature with middle childhood students within an integrated language arts approach in a comprehensive literature program.

column2: TEACHING MATHEMATICS IN THE INTERMEDIATE YEARS, GRADES 4-5
column4: ECED 40147 with a minimum grade of C; and graduate standing.
column6: To develop knowledge of the theories, materials and methods used to teach mathematics in the contemporary classroom for grades 4-5 and develop skill in their use.

column2: STUDENT TEACHING IN MIDDLE CHILDHOOD
column4: Special approval of program coordinator and graduate standing.
column6: Full-time student teaching for twelve weeks on an interdisciplinary team in two selected concentrations (mathematics, language arts, social studies, science) and reading in grades 4-9. Students are required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at their assigned ¿school/agency¿ before the first day of the semester in which student teaching/ internship will take place.

column2: CRITICAL INQUIRY AND INTEGRATION: SCIENCE AND SOCIAL STUDIES, GRADE 4
column6: Introduces students to fourth grade content using an interdisciplinary, inquiry approach to teaching and learning in science and social studies.

column2: CRITICAL INQUIRY AND INTEGRATION: SCIENCE AND SOCIAL STUDIES, GRADE 5
column6: Engages students in the use and development of pedagogical content knowledge for teaching grade 5 using an interdisciplinary, inquiry approach to teaching and learning in science and social studies.

column2: INQUIRY INTO PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE MIDDLE CHILDHOOD
column4: Minimum grade of C (2.000) in CI 67107 and in MCED 50007 and graduate standing.
column6: A seminar linked to student teaching with an emphasis on action research as professional development, completion of professional portfolios, professional ethics and legal, medical and ethical issues in teaching.
